content.description: Let random variable <math alttext="uppercase X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of movies screening at movie theaters in a certain city. The following table shows the cumulative probability distribution of the discrete random variable <math alttext="uppercase X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></math>.
content.question: <math alttext="lowercase x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="the probability of, uppercase x is less than or equal to lowercase X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>X</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 1 0.2 2 0.5 3 0.6 4 0.7 5 0.8 6 0.9 7 1.0 Andromeda claims the distribution of <math alttext="uppercase X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></math> is skewed to the right with mean equal to 4 movies. Is Andromeda’s claim supported by the table?

choices.label: Yes, the distribution is skewed to the right with mean equal to 4 movies.
No, the distribution is skewed to the left with mean greater than 4 movies.
No, the distribution is skewed to the left with mean less than 4 movies.
No, the distribution is skewed to the right with mean greater than 4 movies.
No, the distribution is skewed to the right with mean less than 4 movies.

content.answer: No, the distribution is skewed to the right with mean less than 4 movies.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.7: Introduction to Random Variables and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
